resources.string: When describing your situation, be as descriptive as possible. It\'s important to note your surroundings.
A few helpful questions you can ask yourself are:

1. Who was I with?
2. What was I doing?
3. When did it happen?
4. Where was I?

Include a specific time frame that does not exceed 30 minutes. For example, there are too many different situations, emotions, and thoughts that can occur \"all day Tuesday.\" A better description might be \"Tuesday at noon.\"
Good example:\n"Friday morning at 8. Making coffee. Kids are getting ready for school. Husband is watching the news."
Bad example:\n"Friday before work. Very loud. Irritated at husband."
